item.title: Mount Shasta Wilderness- Anemone occidentalis population
item.description: I went on a quick overnight to a spring fed creek above 8000 feet on Mount Shasta. I noticed these interesting flowers that I have never seen before. They reminded me of something that Dr. Suess would have illustrated in his various children’s books. After searching the internet with no luck I finally needed rely on some California Botany experts to help with the ID: Anemone occidentalis. The hair-like calyx tissue on top of each ovary are what give this plant it’s unique look once reproductively mature.
